Rust releases are not currently distributed as binaries for Linux and OS X, but for this tutorial we've created a special build of Rust 0.9 to avoid needing to compile the compiler before getting started. Follow the instructions below as appropriate for your platform.

Linux

Prerequisites: gcc 
$ curl -O http://static.rust-lang.org/rust-0.9-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz
$ tar xzf rust-0.9-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz
$ rust-0.9/bin/rustc --help

OS X

Prerequisites: Xcode 
$ curl -O http://static.rust-lang.org/rust-0.9-x86_64-apple-darwin.tar.gz
$ tar xzf rust-0.9-x86_64-apple-darwin.tar.gz
$ rust-0.9/bin/rustc --help

If you are running a 32-bit CPU

Use http://static.rust-lang.org/rust-0.9-i686-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz or http://static.rust-lang.org/rust-0.9-i686-apple-darwin.tar.gz instead.

If the binaries don't work

Then build from source... 
$ curl -O http://static.rust-lang.org/dist/rust-0.9.tar.gz
$ cd rust-0.9
$ ./configure
$ make install

If you are on Windows

Find another computer that is not running Windows or follow the instructions on the Rust wiki.
